title: Add social media links (Discord, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, Reddit) to the Community section

requirements.text: Update the Community section to display social media link cards/buttons for Discord, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, and Reddit (5 total) and make each item an actual outbound link that opens in a new tab.

quotes:
add socialmedia link 

discord channel

Instagram channel

facebook 

twiiter

redditt
in a communtity section

acceptanceCriteria: The Community section (frontend/src/components/Community.tsx) shows 5 distinct items: Discord, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, and Reddit.
Each item is clickable and navigates to its configured URL using an anchor/link behavior (not a no-op button).
Each outbound link opens in a new tab and uses rel="noopener noreferrer".
User-facing labels are spelled correctly and in English (e.g., "Twitter/X" or "X").
Layout remains responsive and visually consistent with the existing Community card styling (neon/glow theme).

requirements.text: Add configurable URL placeholders/constants for each social platform link used in the Community section so the actual channel/profile URLs can be set in one place without changing the component structure.

quotes:
discord channel

Instagram channel

facebook 

twiiter

redditt

acceptanceCriteria: Community component has a single, clearly named configuration object/constant for the five platform URLs.
If a URL is empty or undefined, the corresponding UI state is non-clickable/disabled and clearly indicates it is unavailable (while preserving layout).

requirements.text: Update the Footer "Community" link list to match the Community sectionâ€™s supported platforms (Discord, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, Reddit) and ensure each footer link points to the appropriate external URL (not just #community).

quotes: add socialmedia link ... in a communtity section

acceptanceCriteria: Footer community links (frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx) include Discord, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter/X, and Reddit.
Footer community links open the configured external URLs in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer".
Footer no longer lists platforms not requested (e.g., Telegram) unless explicitly retained in addition to the requested ones.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI component sources).
Keep changes limited to frontend social/community UI; no backend changes are required.
nonGoals: Adding third-party embeds (e.g., Instagram feed widgets) or API integrations for social platforms.
Implementing authentication or account linking for social platforms.
